SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.edugility.objexj.engine
Class Thread<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.edugility.objexj.engine.Thread<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of items this Thread will read
All Implemented Interfaces:
ThreadScheduler<T>, Cloneable, Runnable
public class Thread<T>
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Runnable, ThreadScheduler<T>

A virtual thread for running Instructions from a regular expression Program. A Thread may be in several states:

  • Viable. A Thread is viable when its state is VIABLE and when it has a valid program counter.
  • Dead. A Thread is dead when its state is DEAD. Death occurs when the die() method is invoked. Internally, die() is invoked in some cases by the step() method and the advanceProgramCounter() method. A dead Thread will return false from the following methods:
    • canRead()
    • isViable()
    Additionally, a dead Thread will throw an IllegalStateException from any other method that is invoked.
  • Match. A Thread is a match when its getState() method returns MATCH. A Thread is placed in the MATCH state by invoking the match() method. A Thread in the MATCH state effectively cannot do anything other than report its submatches.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
R. S. Cox. (2009, December). Regular Expression Matching: the Virtual Machine Approach [Online]. Available: http://swtch.com/~rsc/regexp/regexp2.html

Field Detail

VALID_NO_INPUT_POINTER

public static final int VALID_NO_INPUT_POINTER
A legal value for a Thread's item pointer, provided that there is no input to read from.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Thread

public Thread(Object id,
              ProgramCounter<T> programCounter,
              List<T> items,
              int itemPointer,
              ThreadScheduler<T> threadScheduler)
Creates a new Thread without any CaptureGroups or variables.

Parameters:
id - the identifier for the new Thread; used only for its Object.toString() output; may be null
programCounter - the ProgramCounter that houses the Program that will be run by this Thread; must not be null
items - the input to read from; may be null in which case the supplied itemPointer must be equal to 0 or VALID_NO_INPUT_POINTER
itemPointer - the index within the supplied items List from which to begin reading; must be zero or a positive integer less than the supplied items size, or must be equal to VALID_NO_INPUT_POINTER provided that the items List is null or empty
threadScheduler - the ThreadScheduler this Thread will use to spawn and schedule new Threads; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any of the preconditions outlined as part of the parameter descriptions is not fulfilled

Thread

public Thread(Object id,
              ProgramCounter<T> programCounter,
              List<T> items,
              int itemPointer,
              Map<Object,CaptureGroup<T>> captureGroups,
              Map<Object,Object> variables,
              ThreadScheduler<T> threadScheduler)
Creates a new Thread.

Parameters:
id - the identifier for the new Thread; used only for its Object.toString() output; may be null
programCounter - the ProgramCounter that houses the Program that will be run by this Thread; must not be null
items - the input to read from; may be null in which case the supplied itemPointer must be equal to 0 or VALID_NO_INPUT_POINTER
itemPointer - the index within the supplied items List from which to begin reading; must be zero or a positive integer less than the supplied items size, or must be equal to VALID_NO_INPUT_POINTER provided that the items List is null or empty
captureGroups - a Map of CaptureGroups indexed by key that this new Thread will use to store submatches; may be null
variables - a Map of variables this Thread will be initialized with; may be null
threadScheduler - the ThreadScheduler this Thread will use to spawn and schedule new Threads; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any of the preconditions outlined as part of the parameter descriptions is not fulfilled
See Also:
getSubmatches(), getVariables()

See Also:

getSubmatches

public final Map<Object,List<T>> getSubmatches()
Returns an unmodifiable Map of submatches found by this Thread.

This method never returns null.

The values in the Map that is returned are guaranteed not to be null and are unmodifiable.

Returns:
a non-null Map of submatches indexed by the keys they were stored under as a result of the save(Object) and stop(Object) operations

public Map<Object,Object> getVariables()

Marks a position in the input such that corresponding items can be retrieved later.

Parameters:
key - the Object under which to index the position; may be null
See Also:
getSubmatches()

stop

public final void stop(Object key)
Marks the end of a region in the input such that corresponding items can be retrieved later.

Parameters:
key - the Object that was passed to a previous save(Object) call; may be null

newThread

public final Thread<T> newThread(Object id,
                                 ProgramCounter<T> programCounter,
                                 List<T> items,
                                 int itemPointer,
                                 Map<Object,CaptureGroup<T>> captureGroups,
                                 Map<Object,Object> variables)
Creates a new Thread and returns it. Implementations of this method must not return null.

Specified by:
newThread in interface ThreadScheduler<T>
Parameters:
id - the identifier for the new Thread; may be null and used only for its Object.toString() method
programCounter - a non-null ProgramCounter to initialize the new Thread with
items - a possibly null List of items that the new Thread may read from
itemPointer - the starting index within the supplied List of items from which the new Thread will read
captureGroups - any CaptureGroups that the new Thread should start out with; may be null or empty
Returns:
a new non-null Thread
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this Thread is not viable

schedule

public final boolean schedule(Thread<T> t)
Schedules the supplied Thread for execution.

This method may be invoked only when isViable() returns true.

This method performs no validity checking of any kind on the supplied Thread, relying instead upon the underlying ThreadScheduler's ThreadScheduler.schedule(Thread) method to perform any checks.

Specified by:
schedule in interface ThreadScheduler<T>
Returns:
true if the supplied Thread was scheduled; false otherwise
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this Thread is not viable

atStart

public final boolean atStart()

atEnd

public final boolean atEnd()
Returns true if this Thread's input pointer is equal to this Thread's input size.

Note: This method may be invoked in any state except Thread.State.DEAD.

Returns:
true if this Thread's input pointer is equal to this Thread's input size; false otherwise

canRead

public final boolean canRead()
Returns true if this Thread is viable, and has more items to read.

This method may be invoked in all states.

Returns:
true if this Thread can read an item

read

public final T read()
Reads (but does not "consume") the current item.

This method may be invoked only when canRead() returns true.

Returns:
the current item which may be null
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the canRead() method returns false
See Also:
canRead()

advanceItemPointer

public final boolean advanceItemPointer()
Advances this Thread's item pointer, provided it was valid to begin with. Returns true if the resulting item pointer is valid.

Please note that a return value of false does not indicate that this Thread is dead.

Returns:
true if this Thread's item pointer was successfully advanced; false otherwise
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this Thread is not viable

getProgramCounter

public final ProgramCounter<T> getProgramCounter()
Returns this Thread's associated ProgramCounter. This method never returns null.

This method may be invoked only when isViable() returns true.

Returns:
this Thread's associated ProgramCounter; never null

advanceProgramCounter

public final boolean advanceProgramCounter()
Advances the program counter to point at the next Instruction in the Program. If this cannot happen—as in the case where there are no more Instructions in the Program—then the die() method is invoked.

This method may be invoked only when isViable() returns true.

Returns:
true if the program counter was successfully advanced and therefore if there is another Instruction ready to be executed; false if this Thread has been killed via the die() method since there are no more Instructions in the Program to be executed
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this Thread is not viable

jump

public final boolean jump(int programCounter,
                          boolean relative)
Sets this Thread's program counter to the supplied value, provided it is valid. If the supplied value is not valid, then this Thread dies.

This method may be invoked only when isViable() returns true.

Parameters:
programCounter -
relative -
Returns:
true if the program counter was actually set; false if it was not (thus indicating that this Thread is now dead)
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied programCounter is not valid
IllegalStateException - if this Thread is not viable

step

public final void step()
Retrieves the current Instruction and executes it.

If the isViable() method returns false, then invoking this method will cause the die() method to be invoked and no further action will take place.

This method may be invoked only when isViable() returns true.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this Thread is not viable

run

public final void run()
Repeatedly calls the step() method until this Thread has completed execution.

This method may be invoked only when isViable() returns true.

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this Thread is not viable

isViable

public final boolean isViable()
Returns true if and only if this Thread's associated state is VIABLE and if its associated ProgramCounter's ProgramCounter.isValid() method returns true.

This method may be invoked in all states.

Returns:
true if and only if this Thread is viable

match

public final void match()
Causes this Thread to irrevocably enter the MATCH state.

This method may be invoked only when isViable() returns true.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this Thread is not viable

die

public final void die()
Causes this Thread to irrevocably enter the DEAD state.

This method may be invoked in all states except MATCH.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this Thread is currently in the MATCH state

getState

public final Thread.State getState()
Returns the Thread.State of this Thread. This method never returns null.

Returns:
a non-null Thread.State
